meanings.definition: A brief summary or note at the beginning of a section or chapter.
meanings.sent1: The headnote at the start of the story gave a quick overview.
meanings.sent2: The headnote on the page helped me understand the chapter.
meanings.sent3: The headnote was so short, it felt like a tiny story teaser.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like a headnote, capturing the essence of joy in a glance.
meanings.sent5: The headnote was like a trailer for the movie, hinting at what was to come.

meanings.definition: A heading or title at the top of a page.
meanings.sent1: The headnote on the paper was bold and clear.
meanings.sent2: I always write my name in the headnote of my assignments.
meanings.sent3: The headnote seemed to be waving at me from the top of the page.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter echoed like a headnote, filling the room with joy.
meanings.sent5: The headnote stood proudly at the top, guiding readers to the content below.

meanings.definition: A note at the beginning of a legal case summarizing key points.
meanings.sent1: The headnote of the legal document highlighted the main arguments.
meanings.sent2: Lawyers often refer to the headnote before delving into the case.
meanings.sent3: The headnote in the legal brief was like a sneak peek into the case.
meanings.sent4: His words were a headnote, setting the tone for the courtroom drama.
meanings.sent5: The headnote was a roadmap, guiding readers through the legal complexities.
